results.title: A Better tomorrow
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of War Information
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The American Scene”.
A study of progressive education in three schools in New York, where the emphasis of teaching is placed on the fact that learning is a normal and vital part of every child’s day-to-day development; what the child is taught in school should therefore bear a discernible relation to the world around the child, and be a challlenge to their increasing skills and expanding understanding of how to manipulate the things whcih surround them.

results.title: A Better man
results.brief_description: This film shows how, in Malaya, a modern prison is not a place of punishment, but a place of reconstruction. Reveals through the eyes of a newly convicted man under sentence of ten years imprisonment, exactly what lies before him and how the prison system of progress and privileges works. At the outset, it is explained to the prisoner what opportunities may be his, so that when he leaves prison he may be a more skilful, better educated man and a valuable citizen of Malaya. No other credits available.

results.title: A Better breed
results.brief_description: An account of the mechanism by which inherited characteristics are handed on from generation to generation, and an introduction to Mendel’s Laws of heredity. Gives examples of the inheritance of one or more characteristics; complete and incomplete dominance; and the recombinations of characteristics resulting in new types; refers to the practical aspects of this in connection with animal husbandry. No other credits available.

results.title: A Bat, a ball and a boy
results.brief_description: Famous Australian cricketers, including Sir Donald Bradman, Richie Benaud, Ray Lindwall, Len Hutton and Neil Harvey illustrate how to improve a boy’s game from batting to bowling to fielding. Includes archival footage of some of Australia’s greatest players.

results.title: A Baby's shoe
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: An abandoned baby girl left on the doorstep of a wealthy family by her poor mother finds herself in strange circumstances years later when fate intervenes and she is rescued by a young man from a runaway horse - unbeknownst to her, the man is her brother. Cast includes Florence Lawrence, Owen Moore, Linda Arvidson, George Nichols, Anita Hendrie, Harry Solter, Mack Sennett. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: A Baby's day at twelve weeks
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, ERPI Classroom Films and Yale Clinic of Child Development
results.brief_description: The infant is followed through its domestic day from the time of its waking at six o’clock in the morning until the final breast feeding at ten o’clock at night. Presents dressing, bathing, feeding, daytime naps, play, and general care of the infant including an interpretation of the significance of various reactions. Narrated by Arnold Gesell.

results.title: A Baby's day at forty-eight weeks
results.creator_credit: Arnold Gesell, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Yale Clinic of Child Development
results.brief_description: Illustrates prescribed methods of infant care at 48 weeks. Demonstrations include bathing, feeding, playing, and sleeping. Emphasises the importance of cod liver oil and orange juice in the diet, and directs attention to the necessity of regular elimination. Explains the psychological implications and the educational significance of the infant’s everyday experiences at this age.

results.title: 8MMM Aboriginal Radio
results.brief_description: A TV series based at the fictitious 8MMM Aboriginal Radio station – the three M’s standing for the three categories of whitefellas who are drawn to the place – missionaries, mercenaries and misfits.

constellations_other.name: Broadcasting marginal voices
constellations_other.description: The creation of Indigenous broadcasting in Central Australia from the late 1970s meant an array of diverse Black stories could be shared. Today, important stories told by those who physically and metaphorically live on the margins can be broadcast widely.

results.description: A TV series based at the fictitious 8MMM Aboriginal Radio station – the three M’s standing for the three categories of whitefellas who are drawn to the place – missionaries, mercenaries and misfits.

results.title: 7th Australian jamboree
results.brief_description: Attended by scouts from all over Australia and from 23 neighbouring countries at Dandenong, Victoria. Shows the official opening; presentation of silver kangaroo to sir Charles Maclean; visit by the Governor and Chief Scout of Victoria; demonstration of Maori cooking; girl guide pageant attended by Lady Delacombe; thanksgiving; arena displays by each state; closing parade and candlelight ceremony. No narration.
